Understate: The claim may be understating the percentage of undocumented children who do not show up in court by stating that 90% do not appear, while the available data suggests that the percentage for all immigrants who fail to appear is around 30%.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific data or evidence to support the statement that 90% of undocumented children do not show up in court.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reason for undocumented children not showing up in court is solely due to their own actions, without considering other factors such as lack of legal representation or understanding of the process.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why undocumented children do not show up in court, such as fear of deportation or difficulty in navigating the legal system.
